In some other countries, the volunteering is part of the school itself and this is an advantage. You can go to workshops and extend your range of knowledge with history, informatics, design etc.; you can help needy like elderly or poor children from disadvantaged area and you can also get involved in your community.  The final aspect of volunteer work is the demantatoryness, which is quite controversing due to the fact that few students with special talents may have been forbidden to do some other things by teachers as to do volunteer work. For instance, a very clever guy from Germany was forbidden by his teacher to go to Olympics on the reason he has to do volunteer work and Olympics are held anNually. You see a request for articles in a magazine: We invite you to write about: _The Future of Travel_. In what ways do you think travel will be different in the future? In what ways might it still be the same? The writer of the best article will win a prize! Write your article.

'Welcome aboard', reliable Captain talked to me. 'Thank you', I answered and got on the flying ship. Today, my dream came true because space trip realized at last. Many passengers had already taken their seats. They looked so happy. Ion engine started, and the giant ship flew up. For this day, all attendants had trained hard. At noon, lunchtime came. Dried foods tasted good, and beverages made us relaxed. The scenery out of the window was fantastic, and I thought I remembered this beautiful sightseeing forever. Suddenly, alarm warned and all the lights turned off. Trouble might occur. 'Please, calm down', Captain announced. 'Air conditioner has broken. We will fix it'. One hour later, the passengers repaired the facility, and we could go back the earth. When we arrived at the station, we all applauded. Some people started to cry. The development of technology is fabulous, and our lives will become rich more and more.

Would you like to live a long, calm life until 100 years old or would you prefer a shorter life but much more intense. Decide and explain your reasons.

I believe that both of the options have their valid benefits but I myself would prefer to live a long and calm life over a short and intense one. That is because of a few different reasons. First of all life does not only consist of the adventures you experience, it is also about your friends and family. A short life would not allow you to spend as much time with them as a long one does. In the end your fast and intense lifestyle may cause emotional pain to your loved ones. Secondly I am not that adventurous as a person as well. I like to chill with my friends and relax on my own, but a real adventure scares me more than it brings me a rush and joy, which makes the option of a longer and calmer life sound far more appealing to me. Of course I do see positive aspects of a more intense lifestyle as well. Many people ask  themselves what they achieved at the end of their lives, because at last only the most exciting parts stick in your memory. A person who did plenty of those intense things may feel more fulfilled than a person who always chose the safe path in life. Although I could see that point as well I still believe that a calm life would be the perfect choice for me if I could take matters into my own hands.

Further more the shops will be more safe because of the decresing number of the thefts, the same as in the public transport. I advise you to check the law for these inconvienients  To sum all up, this prohibition suits the best the citizens addiction to their mobile phones but there are also a lot of cases when they really need to use their phones....

Include details about what you like about the tool and about any difficulties you had with it, and finish by giving your recommendation for other readers. Write your **review**.

For those who are studying English, 'Write&Improve (W&I)' is recommended. I can point out a lot of those advantages. The specific reasons are as follows. Let's start to explain W & I. This is a system evaluates the English sentences that  a student selects one of the pre-prepared tasks and composits using IT technology. Grammar errors and misuse of terms are indicated, and learners can learn the correct expressions. To learn English, you can think of going to school or reading textbooks by yourself. However, English conversation classes are expensive, and in the case of self-study, it is not easy to maintain motivation. W&I is free of charge. There is also a function that makes you want to continue learning. When you submit English sentences, the score is shown. Students want to get a high score, so you will study English hard to get a high score, and if you get a high score, you will study further to get a higher score. W&I can also learn anytime, anywhere if you have access to the Internet. W&I is created and run by Cambridge, a sophisticated education system. You will be able to learn English effectively with a high level of educational knowledge.

Your friend Leyla had a birthday party yesterday. Leyla invited you to the party but you couldn<U+2019>t go. Write a note to Leyla. In your note:<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> * tell her why you couldn<U+2019>t go to the party<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> * ask her what happened at the party<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> * invite her to do something with you next weekend.<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> Write about 70 words.

Dear Leyla, How are things with you? I bet you are still feeling the effects of your sleepless night. I heard it through the grapevine that your party was a real blast and it went on till the small hours! I wish I was there! I must confess, I feel terrible for not being able to put in an appearance yesterday night and to wish you happy birthday. I hope you will forgive me once I have told you the reasons for my absence. As you might recall, I have been toying with the idea of competing in a poetry prize for a long time. It is a dream I have been nurturing since my childhood thanks to my grandmother, who used to spend her afternoons reading me the most famous poets’ sonnets. Well, to cut a long story short, I came across an advertisement about a poetry competition for teenagers in New Castle. In less than no time I submitted my application with a poem titled 'A sunset tinged with gold', and, guess what, I ended up winning the first prize! The award ceremony was scheduled last night, and that is the reason why I could not come to your party. Anyway, stop talking about me!I cannot wait to know all the juicy gossip about your party! How was it like? What were you wearing? Who were the guests? What happened? And how about your presents? Come on, fill me in on every tiny detail.  Our mutual friend Jason told me he had a whale of a time at the party. I bumped into him this morning and he said he could not help but sing your praises for the first-class event you had organised. Not only he extolled the virtues of the catering service, but he also sang the praises of the rock band you had hired in order to spice up the atmosphere. He said that even the rain could not put a damper on your special night. Finally, I would like to make up for my absence at your party inviting you at my house for a special weekend. We could go for a stroll along the lakefront, or we could spend some quality time together sunbathing on the shore of Lake Como. I am sure it will be a weekend of sheer relax, as well as of social whirlwind! I am looking forward to seeing you. Sarah

Your friend Rie sends you an email:<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> _Hi, Can you come to my house for dinner tomorrow? What do you like to eat? Come at 7 o'clock. See you. Rie_ Write a note to Rie. In your note:<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> * say you can come to dinner<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> * say what you like to eat.<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> Write about 30 words.

Hi Rie, Thank you very much for your invitation! I am thrilled to bits at the idea of coming over to your place tomorrow evening. It has been ages since we last saw each other, and I am dying to catch up with all the news I have been missed while I was abroad for my job swap. It goes without saying that I am glad to accept your invitation and I do relish the idea of spending some quality time together reminiscing about the good old times. When it comes to my dietary requirements, I feel duty bound to give you a fair warning. As you may recall, I have always been a bit of a fussy eater. First of all, having a history of gastrointestinal disease, I have no alternative but to eat gluten-free bread and pasta. Secondly, as I suffer from food allergies, artificial colours and preservatives are banned from my daily eating habits. Unfortunately, this means that I will always be deprived of the pleasure of tasting savoury snacks, salty crisps and spicy hot ready-made meals, which are exactly the things that are said to make your mouth water. In addition to that, I have recently become a non-meat eater. I decided to give up eating meat in order to reduce my carbon footprint and do my part in tackling global problems, such as pollution and climate change. Given this long list of dietary requirements, I cannot help but asking you to prepare a light but nourishing meal. If I were you, I would serve a fresh and healthy salad. If I remember rightly, you are the master of gourmet salads: I love the one called 'Garden salmon salad', which is packed with courgettes, peas, pea shoots and radishes. I am sure that this recipe will make the most of the summer’s ingredients. As a main course, I would go for a tray of dairy produce which is so refreshing in the dog days of summer. I am well aware that it is not what you would call a slap-up meal, but it is a dinner that caters for girls, like the two of us, who have to count the calories! What’s more, we can keep a bit of a room for some pudding, which is a must for girls, like the two of us, who have a sweet tooth! I am looking forward to seeing you tomorrow evening! Have a good day Jessica

You have been asked to write a short **article** for your school magazine with the title: _My reasons for learning English_ Describe your reasons for learning English **and** explain why it is important to you. **Write your article.**

It is a widespread belief that learning English is a gateway to a fulfilling and rewarding professional career. I firmly believe that it is true, and I am going to provide evidence to support the claim in this article. Nowadays, a comprehensive knowledge of English is of paramount importance for those who aim to carve out a successful career abroad. As far as I am concerned, mastering English well enough to work in an English-speaking country is one of my most cherished dreams. There are plenty of reasons that prompted me to accumulate an extensive knowledge in this language. First of all, I would like to draw attention to the beneficial effects that an excellent grasp of English is bound to have on my career path. As a professional journalist, I have been nurturing the lifelong ambition of working at The Washington Post since I was a child. Now that I am a grown-up woman, I am determined to make this dream come true. A proven ability in writing and speaking English with an amazing degree of accuracy is likely to allow me to get a foot in the door in this world-renowned newsroom whose journalistic tradition is a pillar of democracy.  Next, I hold firmly to the belief that an advanced level of English is an immense asset when it comes to building relationships. As a lingua franca, English is understood everywhere, thus making it easier for people to communicate. By socialising with people coming from all over the world, it will be easier for me to strike up new friendships, rub shoulders with the movers and shakers in the media industry, as well as explore new cultures and broaden my horizons.  Finally, there is no denying that the journey of learning English has brought out the best in me, revealing a burning desire to see the world and a remarkable gift for languages which will certainly come in useful in the not-to-distant future.

Most medical doctors want to work in cities where they will make a lot of money. Yet in many rural areas there are not enough doctors. What are the reasons for this problem? How can it be solved?

In some offices, employees work in enclosed workstations or cubicles. Other offices have a more open design, in which there are no walls separating employees from their coworkers. Which type of arrangement do you think is most effective? Explain, giving reasons to support your answer.

Whether a single-user workstation or a business office that is not divided into individual compartments (bullpen) is better for the worker, depends on the functions the office has to accomplish.  An open space office or also called, a cube farm, has the following advantages: it allows a better cooperation and communication between the workers. The optimisation of a flexibile working is a huge benefit of this concept.   In workstations that are closed, people are hindred to communicate with one another. This makes it difficult to reach another co-worker. An advantage of this concept is that every worker is able to tend his job in peace.  New enterprises profit from open space offices. If you want to let an enterprise grow and your team is getting larger, such a concept makes it easier to add desks, chairs and walls.  An open space office enhances the moral value of the work team in general. It gets rid of social roles and helps each member to become more accessible one another. This leads to a more efficient workflow. Such a concept also has no hierarchies. Open space offices have a disadvantage of producing much noise. If there will be much telephoning, workers might be disturbed. A remedy for this flaw could be to install focus zones.

Is learning to speak a foreign language as important these days as it was in the past? Write an **essay** giving your opinion.

Nowadays, Chinese people work everywhere, all over the world. Therefore, if you want to work in the world, you should learn Mandarin which is very important as well as English because most people can’t speak English. Therefore, if you want to communicate with them, you need to speak Mandarin.  Firstly, you can easily communicate with Chinese people when you go to China if you can speak Mandarin skills. When I traveled to Shanghai, I ordered bubble tea in English. However, the staff was confused so she wanted to change places with another staff who  could speak English.    Furthermore, I asked the station staff where the toilet was but they only used body language. As a result, I couldn’t communicate with them smoothly. If I had spoken Mandarin, I would have been able to communicate with them easily. Since then, I have felt the need to speak Mandarin.  Lastly, Chinese people have very ambitious personalities and they have a strong connection with other Chinese people. In fact, there are a lot of Asian groceries in the city of Melbourne. Most Asian groceries are managed by Chinese people. It is easy to get a job and you can work a range of different jobs all over world if you can speak Mandarin.   For the reason above, Mandarin become an essential language for all of the world. Besides, it also will be the biggest economy in the future. Therefore, it has a lot of advantages if you have speaking Mandarin skills.

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

We the people shape the upcoming future for the improvement in living standards, for the betterment of future and for mankind. Therefore health of the kids / teenagers is absolutely essential and important as their education.  Our world is changing. We are facing unprecedented challenges that the world has never faced before and therefore it is crucial for the young generation to stay fit and healthy as a healthy man is always asset to the country's overall development.  But things are becoming worse nowadays. Schools are providing kids with so much homework that they are not getting enough time to go outside and play. They lack patience, lack qualities to work in a team and are becoming more and more dependent on their parents for almost everything. This is an issue which needs to be addressed. Adding to this is their eating habits. They always want something that suits their tongues. Due to this they can't tolerate and can manage different conditions which is  very important as they have to go round the world.  Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Let them glide in the highest skies or swim in the deepest ocean. Let them open their mind and allow them to have time with their friends. This will not only allow them to with their friends and work in a team but it will bring the qualities in them that is essential for the upcoming generation. You have recently had a class discussion about the importance of taking care of your health. Now your English teacher has asked you to write an essay giving your opinions on the following statement: _It is more important to be healthy than to be rich._ Write your **essay.**

In my opinion, health and wealth go hand in hand. To understand my point of view, I think it's important to take a closer look at the words health and wealth.  First of all, we generally associate health with our physical condition and the health of our bodies. But today, especially in times of lockdown, we find that mental health is also very important. Many people suffer from not being able to work and earn money. They feel bad about not being able to see their desires, their wishes, their ambitions unfulfilled. In addition, their social status is very important. Feeling useless with an inability to climb the social ladder, they find themselves in a moving situation. Earning money is crucial for a balanced life.  Secondly, wealth cannot be reduced to the amount of money you have in your account. The ability to learn, to acquire new skills, to have friends and to understand other points of view can be considered rich. This process plays an essential role in the balanced life we seek.  In conclusion, being rich is essential for maintaining good health.

Your English teacher told you about Write and Improve and said you should use it to practise and improve your English writing.<U+00A0> Your teacher has asked you to write **a report** about your experience with Write and Improve, describing what you liked or didn<U+2019>t like about it and why. Some people believe zoos are good places for people to learn about animals. Other people believe animals belong in nature and it is wrong to keep them in zoos. What do you think? Explain, giving specific reasons for your choice.

There has always been a lot of heated debate surrounding the issue of zoos, and disputes over this topic have steadily increased in the last decades. Opinions are divided as to whether these places should be closing or they should continue to play a key role in today's conservation issues. While it is true that animals may suffer when deprived of their freedom, there is no doubt that zoos, if successfully managed, are considered to be valuable wildlife sanctuaries and excellent learning fields. First of all, zoos play a pivotal role in protecting endangered species and saving animals from extinction. As far as animal health is involved, there is no denying that zoos are key to the survival of wild species, which are increasingly threatened by poachers, wild predators as well as shrinking natural habitats. Another important aim for zoos is to foster research projects so as to broaden the knowledge of animal behaviour and disease, thus increasing their physical and mental wellbeing. There are teams of international scientists that are devoted specifically to carry out first-rate research which is likely to improve our understanding of the natural world we live in. The more we know about animals, the more we can push the frontiers of our knowledge in new and exciting directions for the sake of both humans and animals. Apart from learning, there is growing evidence that zoos might contribute towards raising people’s awareness on environmental issues. Parks where animals are held in captivity are often the only bridge between people who live in urban settings and nature. For example, planning a trip on zoos or spending a day in a natural habitat, though artificially recreated, seems to generate a great deal of interest in environmental issues, such as the importance of biodiversity, the risk of loss habitat, the need to respect the ecological balance. With an environmental catastrophe at hand, there is every likelihood that zoos will be acting as a role model in conservation efforts in the following years. To sum up, most animal lovers seem to support the idea that zoos are detrimental to animal wellbeing. However, increasing numbers of people, myself included, take the view that allowing animals to live and bred in a secure and protected environment will bring about benefits for humanity.

Some high schools have a requirement that students must complete a certain amount of volunteer work in order to graduate. What do you think about this type of requirement? Give details to support your opinion.

Many people believe that high school students should be involved in mandatory volunteerism. While it is true that this unpaid activity may burden students with a surplus of work, I firmly believe that social activism, personal growth and career development are opportunities that cannot be underestimated. Therefore, it is evident that students can benefit a great deal from engaging in high school compulsory volunteering. When it comes to social engagement, mandatory volunteerism plays a key role in nurturing a sense of civic responsibility and good citizenship in young people. By supporting vulnerable people who live in the neighbourhood or helping local organisations raise awareness on environmental issues, youngsters can experience the emotional fulfilment of feeling part of a community. Consequently, civic engagement will help students become aware of the world around them, foster their understanding of problems and encourage them to be part of the solutions.  Involvement in community services is closely related to personal growth. Hands-on experiences in working within poverty-stricken contexts and in dealing with people from all walks of life are likely to build youngsters’ character and boost their confidence. In addition to that, students are bound to learn new skills which will surely be in good stead in their professional career: Ability to collaborate with people with diverse backgrounds, effective communication, leadership and empathy will surely be considered a competitive edge in the workplace. In spite of the workload, there is no doubt that students will benefit a great deal from experiencing volunteerism throughout  their high school attendance. By doing social activities, they are on the path to becoming more civic-minded citizens, ethic-oriented individuals and high-skilled professionals.

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

       It is well-known that a healthy lifestyle is provided by sport activities done with frequency so, as far as I am concerned, the proposition that all university students and school children should be forced to practise sports activities at least 3 times per week is a good intentioned one and I one agree with.        First things first, the inactive lifestyle is a problem all humanity is facing nowadays. Because of the development of technology and the constantly increasing level of living standards, people are often choosing sedentarism to the detriment of sport or physical activities. People are moving from home to work or school and backwards by car or by means of transport instead of walking, either because of confortness or facillity, for that many cities are too wide to be able to move around walking. This is the reason why they spend almost their entire day sitting; they sit at school or at work, sit in the car or public transport, sit at home watching a movie on TV or browsing on the phone. Therefore, it will be a major success if at least the children and students will practise some sports 3 times a week.         Also, schoolers and students are the most prone categories for inactivity, because studying ocupies most of their time as so they spend more than half a day sitting on a chair. Although they can spend their breaks and their free time to relax outside and practise some physical activities like jogging or playing sports with friends, the opption they choose is not always the healthy one, most of them preferring to spend the free time chatting and surfing the Net, or simply watch some movies. If not the sport at school, this inactive lifestyle would lead to severe spine deformations, bone fragility and many other diseases.        Finally, I consider that the decision of making soprt in schools and universities mandatory is the right one, keeping in mind the inactive lifestyle everyone adopts today, in spite of an active one.

You see a request for articles in a magazine: We invite you to write about: _The School of the Future_. In what ways do you think schools will be different in the future? In what ways might they still be the same? The writer of the best article will win a prize! Write your article.

Computers and other technological devices have become an essential tool in all areas of education. While I agree that this is true, I also believe that teachers will continue to play a crucial role in the classroom of the future. On the one hand, I agree with those who claim that blended learning is fundamental to the education sector. First, computer-based lessons are considered to be more engaging than the ones taught by teachers. Next, interactive websites and online videos are more likely to interest students, thus improving their knowledge retention and performances during exams. Finally, computers are a potentially unlimited source of information for learners. A good example could be the following: In the past, students could not help but rely on books and printed maps when asked to do research related to geography. Nowadays, software packages like Google Earth enable students to virtually visit any city of the world, even the most remote villages, thus boosting the learning process.  On the other hand, I believe that educators will not be replaced by artificial intelligence, no matter how sophisticated technology becomes. There are two reasons why I think teachers will always be at the centre of the learning experience. First, not only good educators impart knowledge, but they also nurture the passion for learning and help children develop critical thinking.  Empathy is another reason for supporting the pivotal role of teachers in the classroom. Educators can understand the emotional state of their students by reading their face, body language and appearance. Consequently, whenever they spot a weird behaviour or they become aware of some difficulties, they can connect with pupils by having meaningful conversations with them. Apart from providing children with invaluable emotional support, teachers can also maintain a close relationship with their parents. In conclusion, I agree that technology is helpful in the classroom. However, I believe that teachers will continue to thrive because of their inspirational role in youngsters’ lives.

Read and answer the question below. Write at least 2 paragraphs. Some people sleep in a dark and quiet room. Other people sleep with a small light on and don't mind noise. How do you like to sleep? Explain your answer.

There has always been a heated debate surrounding the issue of sleeping habits. Opinions are divided as to whether we should sleep in total darkness and stony silence or we should get used to some degree of light and noise. Enthusiasts of refreshing and plentiful naps tend to extoll the benefits of dark and silent bedrooms because they think they are essential to lull us to sleep. However, more and more people are admitting that they can sleep through anything, including claps of thunder, or even their partner’s severe snoring. As I have always been a deep sleeper, I do not mind dozing off in a bedroom where there is little light or noise. However, either dazzling beams of light or piercing noises are likely to keep me awake throughout the night. There is no doubt that falling asleep in dark and silent bedrooms can make all the difference when it comes to sleep quality. There is growing scientific evidence to support the fact that rooms deprived of noise and darkness can have beneficial effects on people's physical and mental wellbeing. For instance, when we turn off the lights just before going to bed, our body starts to release melatonin, the sleep-inducing hormone. The higher levels of melatonin are released in the blood, the higher are the chances for people to fall asleep. Therefore, having too bright an environment when it is time to sleep can disrupt the natural circadian rhythms, thus making people more alert and prevent them from enjoying a refreshing sleep.  When it comes to my sleeping patters, I certainly prefer falling asleep in a free-noised and dark environment. However, as I have have never suffered from sleep deprivation, I do not mind dozing off even in case there is moderate light in the bedroom.

Some students choose to study in another country for a time during high school or university. What do you think are the advantages and disadvantages of studying abroad?

Studying abroad is a choice that attracts thousands of students every year. While it is true that this experience has many advantages, it also has its drawbacks. The beneficial effects of studying in another country are undeniable. As a start, being exposed to a foreign language is of enormous importance in the language acquisition process. Therefore, students who are eager to learn a second or a third language are likely to make the most of their experiences abroad. For instance, engaging in conversation with people every day may help young adults learn the language faster, retain it better and speak with a near-native pronunciation. In addition to language acquisition, spending time away from home may encourage students to familiarise themselves with different cultures, thus improving their cultural understanding. For instance, getting to grips with new rules and social norms or engaging with a new culture can turn out to be invaluable tools to see the world through different lenses. What is more, whichever language students are going to learn, studying abroad will provide them with the opportunity to meet and interact with people from all walks of life. However, studying abroad is not always associated with positive effects. First, living away from home for a certain amount of time can be ridiculously expensive. Several students simply cannot afford to pay the rent or university fees in the first place. For those who organise the trip on a shoestring, there’s every likelihood that they will come back home frustrated by all the hurdles they had to overcome along the path. Next, living in a place where the nearest and dearest are far away can be extremely difficult. The odds are students will feel homesick, with major consequences on their mental wellbeing. Cultural shock is another aspect to take into consideration when it comes to the downsides of studying in a host country. Different countries mean different cultures and social norms. Adapting to a new culture may cause some physical symptoms such as insomnia, headache and loss of appetite, which are bound to contribute to making the experience disappointing. There is no denying that studying abroad can be an immense asset for students, especially in the language learning process. However, this experience can put students off easily due to the high costs, the fear of loneliness and the culture shock.

Video games are very popular with children. However, some parents feel that video games can have a negative impact on their children, but others believe that they may have some positive effects. How do you feel about children playing video games? Give specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.

Video games have never been so popular among youngsters. To a certain extent, I agree that this pastime is likely to trigger health problems in teenagers as well as putting their relationships at risk. However, I also believe that a moderate use of these devices can help them enhance their cognitive development and build problem-solving skills. There is growing evidence that playing video games for an inordinate amount of time may be harmful for teenagers’ health and may deplete their ability to bond with their peers. First, spending hours glued to the TV or computer screen may encourage them to live a sedentary life, thus increasing the risk of developing weight-related diseases such as diabetes or heart problems in the long run. Next, health diseases may be compounded by the onset of dysfunctional behaviour or poor mental wellbeing, which are considered the inevitable outcome of social isolation. It is no wonder that spending a great deal of time absorbed in gaming activities can prompt teenagers to stay in rather than hang out with their peers,  However, being exposed to video games for a limited amount of time may have a lot of positive influence on young people. If used with common sense, gaming consoles can help youngsters enhance their cognitive development and build problem-solving skills that may come in handy as they grow up. For example, virtual challenges may encourage young people to think fast in order to deal with an unexpected threat, thus training a skill which will prove useful in real-life settings. Online games can even have beneficial effects on children's attention, vigilance and concentration. Mental flexibility is also enhanced while playing games because teenagers and young adults are likely to learn how to engage in multiple tasks simultaneously. There is no doubt that young people are increasingly addicted to video games. While devoting a great deal of time to this activity may have devastating effects on youngsters’ health and social life, I also think that moderate playing is likely to benefit their cognitive development.

Recently I discovered website called 'Write and improve'. In next week I'll have been using it for a month. Frankly, it's the best writing tool I've ever used. It allows the user to write different types of essays, letters and reviews. It has multiple tasks to do. It has a timer that measures how much time user spent on the task, and after finishing it highlights every mistake. It says what was done wrong and what could've been done better. The user can correct those mistakes and then check the result again. The website also shows us how we improved and on which level our knowledge of English language is. It's advanced and effortless to use. There are no hidden options we need to search for for a long time. We need to create an account, but only data we need to give is our email address. If we want to, the tool can send us emails about our improvements and with the suggestion for the future. What's best about the website is the fact that we don't have to pay money for this. It's only necessary if we want to do tasks like the ones that are on popular exams. The only difficulty I had was to remember my password, but it's common. I had absolutely no other difficulties, and that's why I fell in love with this tool.

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

Obesity in the young is one of the most pressing issues of many developed countries. To a certain extent, I agree that a sedentary lifestyle, compounded by poor dietary habits, may be detrimental to youngsters’ health. However, I do not agree that school children and university students should be forced to do sports activities at least three times per week. There is no doubt that physical activity is one of the most effective ways to prevent weight-related diseases in the young. However, as children are constantly absorbed by social media platforms and glued to TV screens, they are increasingly engaged in virtual gatherings and online gaming platforms, with a dramatic reduction of the time spent in sports activities. The shift towards online playtime, which is synonymous with physical inactivity, is likely to have negative repercussions on youngsters' health. As children are becoming more and more obese, weight-related illnesses are on the rise at an alarming pace. Cardiovascular diseases and chronic health conditions, such as heart attack, stroke and type 2 diabetes, are increasingly affecting the young, thus putting a lot of pressure on national health systems of the developed nations. However, I do not believe that youngsters should be pressured into sports on a weekly basis. First, pushing children to do something beyond their will may end up to be counterproductive. Sports should be fun, not forced. And when the opposite is true, youngsters are likely to experience a further drop in motivation which can result in a complete lack of exercise. Next, forced participation can prevent children from enjoying the activity, both decreasing their desire to succeed and increasing the risk of injuries. These negative connotations may also cause children to miss out on the importance of physical wellbeing and the benefits associated with sports participation. Therefore, students should be encouraged by parents and teachers to stay physically active through activities that combine fun, entertainment and gentle exercise. Finally, pushing children into playing sports at least three times a week can have a negative impact on school achievements. In fact, children that are completely absorbed in sports have less time to focus on their homework but also less energy to devote to academic subjects. Therefore, I think that a balanced relationship between sports activities and school duties will be more beneficial to children’s physical and mental wellbeing.

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

 Many people believe that it is imperative for schools and universities to make sports activities mandatory due to the life-threatening consequences of an unhealthy lifestyle. However, I have to disagree with this statement, as I believe personal health should be exclusively in the hands of the beholder. First, students and pupils ought to be in charge of their own lifestyles. Should the educational institutions impose regular sports activities, the children may not agree with them. What is more, even a sense of hatred towards these healthy practices could be developed by students. For example, imposing sports in schools or universities could label them as useless, and even be ignored by most children. Thus, forcibly applying such activities can have a negative impact on students. Second, explaining the benefits of a healthy and active lifestyle are proven to be more effective than obligating students to do such activities. Studies show that people tend to continue healthy practices given that they understand the benefits of them. As a way to illustrate this, including educational activities on how to include sports in students' daily life rather than forcibly integrating them in schools is more likely to ensure that they will continue living healthily, provided that they understand the usefullness of an active lifestyle. On the other hand, including sports activities in school can improve students' results. Research concluded that working out regularly, which can be achieved by including such activities in schools, can boost the results and the overall results of students. However, I do not find it appropriate to force children to undergo these kinds of activities. In conclusion, imposing sports activities for students is certainly not the most suitable way of leading them into healthy lifestyles. In spite of that, regular exercise could also be beneficial for the results of the students.

Your English friend Chris is coming with you and your family to the local museum next Saturday.<U+00A0> Write an email to Chris. Tell Chris: - how you will travel to the museum - what he can see at the museum - what he needs to bring.<U+00A0> Write 25 words or more.

Dear Chris, How are things with you? How are you spending your summer holiday in Italy? I can easily picture you soaking up the atmosphere and indulging yourself with the delights of the Italian cuisine! So much for you sticking to your diet! Anyway, first things first. I am writing to make you aware of some arrangements I have just made ahead of our trip to the Science and Technology museum in Milan, which is scheduled for next Saturday. As you may already know, Milan is about 50 kilometres away from Bellano, which is the tiny village where my family and I live. Even though driving is probably the most convenient way to get to Milan, I fear that this option will not be available. Unfortunately, our family car broke down on a busy road yesterday and we had to call a tow-truck to take it to a local garage to get it repaired. Therefore, I guess the vehicle will not be roadworthy in the near future. With driving no longer an option, my siblings and I have decided to go for a train journey. I already bought your ticket, so you won’t have to worry about queuing at the ticket office the morning of our trip. Once we get to Milan, we will head to the Science Museum by metro. I can assure you, the journey will not take long. The museum headquarters is on the same line of the train station, so the second leg of the journey is going to take just eight minutes, give or take. The Science Museum we are going to visit is one of the largest scientific and technological museums in Italy. Visitors are given the chance to learn about scientific discoveries through interactive sessions and even experiment with materials and mechanical elements.  If you are interested in getting a taste of the event, the exhibition we are booked in is all about Artificial Intelligence. It is expected to display a collection of portraits drawn by the world's first robot artist. Though futuristic this exhibition may seem, it aims to prompt a large-scale debate about the rapid rise of AI technology and to analyse the relationship between humans and technology. What whetted my curiosity about this exhibition is the fact that the drawings on display are the work of a robot artist, a human-like machine that has been built by a team of programmers, roboticists, art experts and psychologists over a two-year period. I am looking forward to immersing myself in this virtual environment because I feel this topic is fully contemporary. I guess we will have a whale of a time! As I said above, there is no need for you to buy train or subway tickets. I have already bought them. Just to be on the safe side, bring a camera with you. Unfortunately, my camera is on its last legs and, therefore, pretty unreliable. I will not want to risk going back home without photos of this once-in-a-lifetime exhibition! See you on Saturday! John

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

Should we introduce a mandatory sports activities to university students and school children?  This might be a difficult question, however, it is worth examining.  All the evidence suggests that an inactive lifestyle causes the negative effects on health.  A majority of people older than fifty suffers from some kind of chronic diseases, and most of them are not engaged in regular physical activities.  Only when people get older will they realize the importance of exercises.    In my personal view, exposing young people to more physical activity would be the most effective approach the authority could take to improve people's health status.  Therefore, I would definitely agree with mandating sports activities at least three times per week to all university students and school children.    Some people would argue that forcing young people to do physical activity detracts their freedom.  Other may claim that such mandatory program reduces studying time of children.  To a certain limited extent, there is some truth in these arguments.  However, the real situation is that young people would never lose their freedom, rather, they might find important hint on physical activities which they can carry on throughout their life.  In fact, three times per week would only be six hours out of thirty six hours of the whole weekly activity.  Any other academic studies can be achieved in the remaining hours.  I would also like to emphasize the favorable effect of mandatory program.  Children who already like physical activities will do various sports anyway.  It is the matter of children who opt out physical activities.  If they were not forced to do sports, how would they find the  fun of such activities?  Widening the range of opportunities in the early stage is essential to education.  To conclude, I would insist that young people should be engaged regularly in sports activities.  It would have more positive impact than negative effect.

A well-known magazine for English language learners has asked for reviews from readers about useful resources for learning English. You have recently discovered Write and Improve, a new writing tool for learners of English. Write a review for the magazine describing the main features of the tool and why it is/isn<U+2019>t helpful. Include details about what you like about the tool and about any difficulties you had with it, and finish by giving your recommendation for other readers. Write your **review**.

I have recently discovered 'Write and Improve' and would like to give feedback. In this review I would like to evaluate whether 'Write and Improve' is a useful resource for English learners or not.  The main features of this learning tool are written texts. Learners' skills are differentiated between the three levels: beginner, intermediate and advanced. This corresponds to the European Frame of Language Skills, A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, and C2. These are reasonable categories for a student to choose from in order to make faster progress. The focus is laid on distinguishing between the various written forms a student is confronted with in an exam, such as an essay, a letter, a review, and a proposal. Another focus is put on considering the formality and the author of a written piece must know how to choose the adequate vocabolary if he or she writes an informal or a formal letter. What I like on this tool is the feedback if I remembered the question or the task respectively. If the student has completely written about the question he will be rewarded with a 5. A bright yellow mark shows that something is stilistically not alright.   I would definitely recommend this clever tool to English learners. It allows one to enhance the ability to render English texts more quickly and without the temptation to use dictionaries. This tool is definitely able to improve the compository skills of an English student in a most comfortable way, at home and in an reasonable time.

You have been asked to write a short __article__ for your school magazine with the title: *My favourite season of the year.* Describe your favourite season __and__ explain why it is so special for you. __Write your article.__

My favorite season of the year is spring. Because I'm a student of Asia educational program. If you didn’t know, Asia educational program was different from than European or American education program. It was teaching students a lot of knowledge, theory, and obligatory to remember all of them. It also didn’t allow the students to practise or experiment. But it is not over, the family of the students thought that it is so little for their children so they sign for their son, daughter to go to extra classes. So the spring is the only rarely long holiday that they could have the break for 15 days and after that everything would repeating. Some people believe that it is good for students to have the same teacher for several years. Others think students benefit more from having new teachers each year. Which do you think is better? Give specific reasons to support your opinion.

You need to learn with a good teacher for several years so that you can deeply understand your subject. A good teacher helps you to build  foundations. If you constantly change teacher in the first few years, you won't gain basis idea about your learning and what your learning is shallow.  But when you have studied with a teacher for several years, in order to improve yourself  you need to change teacher.  From different teachers you could learn different techniques , skills and gain new ideas. It will help you open your eyes. You can absorb new ideas from different teachers. If you always stay with the same teacher, you just lock yourself in a room and can't see the other world.  It is not good that students frequently change teacher. The student who always complain about  teachers has no patient to deep learning anything. But if you have a curious  heart, at some time you need to change teacher.

 With some restrictions, children can play video games.  Children could  learn things in the video games. While playing games, kids can learn how to react quickly. Playing games can make them work hard in their studies to figure out how to make them and leads them to study computer science.  However, some kids addicted to the video games and don't have enough sleep, don't want to study and whole mind is full of video games , that would destroy them.Now a lot kids doing that way the whole day they stay at home and don't want to communicate with others.It is terrible. We need to get them out of that situation.   Playing video games all the time is a waste time. parents should encourage kids read more books, play sports and limit their time to play video games. Playing games can't be the major activity for them.

Yes, I agree. I agree but actually I want, to add something to this opinion. I properly think that we should replace the words all university students and school children to all people across the world because not just only students, everyone should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Their inactive lifestyle is a summarize of bad things that could harm their health such as eating too much sugar and fast food or laziness to exercise. Nutrition was playing an indispensable role in the human body and health, it was like the rope keeping our life not pass away, it and calories are what keeps our bodies going every day. Although, they together keeping our bodies alive, they played different roles in our bodies.  Nutrition was keeping our organs, skin, hair, and either our bodies alive. Different food would provide you different nutrition and amount of calories to our body. So eating different food every day except it helps we not anorexic, it also helps our bodies better. After all, we should care to watch the calories of our food because our body just needs a specific amount of calories, If you digested more calories than our body need, it can clump and turn into fat deposits in the blood vessel. There will be more and more fat deposits in the blood vessel and soon these fat deposits such much that it can prevent blood from the blood vessels flowing back to the hearth and it's one cause of many cause could lead to a dangerous disease that kills millions of people every year, heart attack. But don't worry, you just need to do exercise every day to help your body be healthy.

Many people believe that it is important to always tell the truth. In your opinion, is it ever acceptable to tell a lie?<U+00A0> Explain your answer giving reasons and specific examples.

While some people contradicts the idea of lying, others might not aggree to such thought. In my opinion, lying should not be considered as a evil enemy but a defence mechanism. In this essay, I will give a reasons for why do poeple tell a lie and I will carefully explain why lying should not adopt in a long run and what would be the negative effects for habit of lying.  Sometimes we end up in a situation where lying seen as a easy way out for that moment. For instance, when someone needs an opinion of yours about a dress that she is wearing or a movie that you watched last night and it is easy to find yourself in a position where not giving your honest opinion because you want to impress that person and giving a partial truth or not the whole truth might be rewarded as a sympathy and increased interest of other person.  On the other hand, white lies and lying in general might cause some problems in the long run. Although, at first not telling the truth might gain you some interest, because the perception of others for you are shaped by your lies, in the you have to find your way out of prodigious numbers of misleading informations that you had been given. That kind of actions becomes as a habit of lying and you will end up in a frustrating life.  In overall, despite the fact that lying can be usefull, it would be wise to use it mindfully because it can transform and demonstrate itself as a dangereous habit.

Your town council is thinking about banning the use of mobile phones on public transport and in shops and restaurants.<U+00A0> Write a letter to the town council giving your opinion about this and why you think it is or is not a good idea.

This letter has been written by a concerned parent. The news spread that the town council is planning to abolish the use of mobile phones in  public transport, in shops and in restaurants.  Although I was raised in a time before internet and the invention of smart phones I plea for accepting the wind of change. We cannot turn the clock back. Technology is changing like the rest of society does. We can't neither deny the existence of the digital era nor ban the use of mobile phones.  These gadgets have become such an integral part of our daily lives that it is unthinkable to set up rules against them. I accomplish many tasks via my mobile phone too, such as booking holidays, and giving in my work shift for the next month.   There are disadvantages of mobile phones. Write to a student in another country describing a special food you like to eat. Make sure to tell them: <U+25CF> what the food is <U+25CF> when you usually eat the food <U+25CF> why you like this food Include more details. Write at least one paragraph.

Hi Rebecca, How are things with you? It’s been ages since we last went out for a meal. I know you’ve been rushed off your feet lately, but I do hope you can free up some time to join me for dinner next Friday. I’d love to kick off the weekend by spending some quality time with you and catching up with all the latest news. You must fill me in on all the juicy gossip of your honeymoon! To mark the occasion, let me ask you over for dinner. I will be treating you with my favourite dish, which is also a true Italian classic: a comforting bowl of tagliatelle with bolognese sauce. As well as being family-friendly and easy to make, this recipe is a champion of versatility. What I like about this dish is the fact that I can always rely on it. Whether I am rustling up a meal in a busy midweek day or cooking to impress friends, tagliatelle with bolognese sauce is something I always turn to. It is a recipe for success! If I am up to my ears in work, I usually go for a classic bolognese sauce. What does it mean? I put onion, celery and carrots in a large pan, I cook them on high heat for five minutes until they are softened, and then I add the mince. After stirring it for five minutes with a wooden spoon, I add the passata. Then, I turn the heat down to medium, thus allowing the sauce to bubble away for 40 minutes. When the thick ragù is ready, I bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil, drop in the pasta and cook it until Al dente. Finally, I put the pasta in a plate and top with bolognese sauce. If I am not too busy, I find it rewarding to upgrade my classic tagliatelle with new ingredients, such as smoked pancetta, dried porcini mushrooms and red wine vinegar. I have recently tried my hand at making a vegetable version of bolognese sauce, which seems to have gone down well with my husband. I’d really love you to have a taste of my new culinary success because, as you know, I really value your feedback on my cooking. You cannot miss the chance to taste this healthy tagliatelle! I am sure it will make your mouth water. Tagliatelle with bolognese sauce is a recipe for every season. I usually get a real kick out of eating bolognese sauce on chilly Sundays, when the days in winter are short and grey. Eating tagliatelle with bolognese sauce in spring is a pleasure, too. In fact, March, April and May are the months in which my husband and I pamper ourselves with delicious Sunday meals under the blossoming patio in the garden.  I hope to have whetted your appetite! See you on Friday! Cheers Giovanna

A well-known magazine for English language learners has asked for reviews from readers about useful resources for learning English. You have recently discovered Write and Improve, a new writing tool for learners of English. Write a review for the magazine describing the main features of the tool and why it is/isn<U+2019>t helpful. Include details about what you like about the tool and about any difficulties you had with it, and finish by giving your recommendation for other readers. Write your **review**.

Review on write and improve  Write and improve is the new tool I have discovered for learning English - a live feedback giving platform.  Firstly, I find really adequate the organisational structure of the tasks - 3 notebooks for each of the 3 levels: beginner, intermediate and advance according to the CEFR levels and also one notebook for the business jargon. I know from experience that you should start from lower levels in order to make progress, albeit you're an experienced speaker, because if you target a more demanding task you'll not be focused enough to finish your composition and you are going to finish up disappointed and bored and closing the internet.  Secondly, I enjoyed the means of costumization as the recording of every single piece of feedback, the graph of improvements and also making your own notebooks and even your own tasks like a teacher does. All this comforted me and made me feel like I was having my own tutor aside me.  Last but not least, I was thrilled to bits by the incredibly short time of waiting feedback and the assessment. Even if the software had been slower I couldn't have complained because all other features are great and the speed of the site can only be seen as a major advantage.  All in all, I recommend write and improve by my heart to all newbies but also advanced learners and I also recommend them to make a schedule and to increase to frequency and the difficulty level of the compositions gradually.

You have seen this notice in an international music magazine: **Articles wanted** **Do we need music in our lives?** Are there times when music is important? How does music make us feel? What would life be like without music? Write and tell us what you think. Write your **article** in **140 <U+2013> 190** words in an appropriate style.

In my opinion, music is very important. Listening to music has many advantages. One of the main reasons that music is important in our life, is that music makes us connect with other people. Sometimes, you can relate with the lyrics, and thereby feel less alone. Music can also lift up your mood. Furthermore, another benefit of music is that it is good for your mental state to learn how to play an instrument.   A life without music would be very dreadful and monotonous. Music plays a big role in our society and culture. The popmusic culture influences many teenagers with their lyrics, clothes, and even behaviour. With music, we feel more connected to people we would normally never meet.   My conclusion is that music plays a huge role in our culture and that we definitely need music in our lives.

Would you like to live a long, calm life until 100 years old or would you prefer a shorter life but much more intense. Decide and explain your reasons.

life is always a good topic that is discussed, different people have different opinions, some think it is better to have a short intense life as it makes their life more meaningful. However, I prefer to live a long, calm life until 100 years old.   I love peaceful life. I really enjoy lying on the bed all days, playing my phone, watching anime and dramas. I am happy to have normal daily life, and having a long life allow me to try different new things in the world, such as traveling into different places and having different types of food. If I have a short life, I wouldn't have enough time doing these things. Intense life is tired, it is suitable for those who want to be a superhero but not ordinary people such as me.   Living in a long life is not only benefits for you but also good for your family. If you have a long life, you will have a chance to stay longer with your family, you will be able to see the birth of your children and even grandchildren. This is really great as you can feel the powerful of life and your parents definitely don't want you die early.   In conclusion, having a long steady life is felicitous as it could allow you understand the world better.

Write about a holiday that you went on that was really important to you. Say where you went and what you saw, and explain why it was the best holiday you ever had.

Write about a holiday that you went on that was really important to you. Say where you went and what you saw, and explain why it was the best holiday you ever had. Almost two years ago I was summering in Helsinki FOR two weeks. It was one of the best holidays in my life. For the first time in my life I decided flying somewhere without giving too many thoughts. I usually choose my destination with a great care. I check background of my stay for example hotels, airports as well as connections guaranteed by public transport.  However, this time was different. It was magnificent time of being there. The capital of Finland is Incomparable to any other place I had ever seen before. The city lies on the hills but they are not similar to Roman hills, it pops out from the real rocks. I could not believe that buildings' foundations standing on the rock. The second scene of the town was the real touch of the history. I could not believe that the Finns have so good relations with neighbouring Russia, although they were involved in many conflicts with their Russian neighbours. The most surprising moment was when I caught a glimpse of an enormous sculpture of the Zar Alexander standing on the major plaza in town. To sum up, I do not remember, that any of my holidays has impressed me so hard. Moreover, my spirit was real touched by the sublime beauty of the city till today.

Your English friend Chris is coming with you and your family to the local museum next Saturday.<U+00A0> Write an email to Chris. Tell Chris: - how you will travel to the museum - what he can see at the museum - what he needs to bring.<U+00A0> Write 25 words or more.

Hello Chris, What have you been up to? I hope this email finds you well.  I can´t complain, I had to get a new job recently, it is not a biggie but now I can save some extra money, this week I have been really busy, in the mornings I am used to working out at the gym after that, I work all the afternoon, fortunately, I am in home-office so I work in my room, at nights I finish exhausted so I sleep all night, in spite of this I am going to be a week off soon, in this time I want to unwind with my friends so I want to invite to you to the science museum.  Next month this museum will inaugurate a new quaint meteorites collection, furthermore, you can know about planets, the Solar system, and the universe. I know that you want to study astronomy at the university so you will love the exposition.  About transportation, don´t worry about it, Museum is in the city center, so I can pick you out at your house, my dad will lend me his car, on the other hand, you don´t need to buy a ticket, only you have to show your student ID and you will enter free.  If you have time to spare, after visiting the museum we can go to eat tacos, in front of the museum will find the best restaurant in the town, I was forgetting it, my treat, or maybe taking a walk in the park will be a better option.  What do you think? If this works for you, please send me a message as soon as possible.  Take care, your friend Tony.

Last week you went on a trip with some students from your class. Write an email to your friend, Billal. In your email:<U+00A0><U+00A0> * say where you went<U+00A0><U+00A0> * say what you did<U+00A0> * say why you enjoyed the trip.<U+00A0><U+00A0><U+00A0> Write about 80 words.

Dear Tom  How are you doing? Besides, I have to congratulate you on achieving the schorlarship. I cannot wait to tell you about the recently trip with my classmate. In some offices, employees work in enclosed workstations or cubicles. Other offices have a more open design, in which there are no walls separating employees from their coworkers. Which type of arrangement do you think is most effective? Explain, giving reasons to support your answer.

Open spaces is the trend now. Though financial brokers and stock market industry has already been working in open design offices for decades. Different option should be studying depending on the business communication in the office. Open space seems to be the more efficient work environment except when the customers who appreciate privacy when they visit you for a review or a service. That means that you still need enclosed desks to receive your clients. A problem will also occur when some people use to talk loudly in an open space. I can't put up with that unrespectful behavior but they don't actually make it on purpose as this is probably their only way of arguing on the phone. This is another reason you would organise some of the desk to be enclosed and separated of the others. As always we can't expect to have an absolute solution for all of the office and we have to figure out a balance between open spaces or cubicle and enclosed offices.

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

More and more young people lead an unhealthy lifestyle because of the lack of time or money. Is forcing them to become active at least 3 times per week and by that intruding their individual lifestyle a justifiable way to solve this problem? Firstly, both students and pupils have to invest a lot of time into studying for school or university. As a result, they are left with a minimum of leisure time. Prompting them to do sports during this remaining time is questionable, as it interferes with their private life. Also, it confines their liberty to choose how they want to spend their spare time, and definitely requires a second thought. Furthermore, whenever something is forced on people, it naturally becomes another burden to carry. Hence, doing sports becomes another task to be delivered. Originally, sports should provide a balance to work and enable the brain to recover and rebuild itself. As a matter of fact, not everyone is physically or mentally able to participate in the same types of sports as the majority of people. Suddenly, including everybody´s individual needs turns out to be a very complex issue. Solutions tailored to special requirements have to be found. For instance, people who are physically limited may need to be equipped with devices in order to participate in e.g. swimming or running. Protheses or artificial limbs are necessary to help these people join in. Yet, making them pay for these augmentations would be highly unfair and unethical. Summing up, I would absolutely dislike the idea of enforcement, as it limits students´ liberties and rights and excludes people with special needs. However, it would be advisable to enlargen the range of sports offered to students and pupils. More alternatives  to the classical types of sports from which to choose will encourage them to participate on a more liberal basis.

Would you like to live a long, calm life until 100 years old or would you prefer a shorter life but much more intense. Decide and explain your reasons.

Nowadays, our biggest wish as humans is to live as many years as possible. The development of technology facilitates the medical treatments for curing people, assuring they are healthy, increasing the chance of living a longer life. But is it all about how many years we wander around in this world? To begin with, at the end of our lives, we don't concentrate on how many years we have lived. Many cultural figures, such as Abraham Lincoln, have exemplified this concept. One of his most famous quotes is 'in the end it's not the years in your life that count; it's the life in your years”. Memories, emotions, and feelings develop us as human beings, thus living more spiritually. Not only do they increase the intensity of a moment, but they also create more powerful memories than the ones of somebody who might choose to live a calmer life. To a further extent, embedding people with cherished memories increases the intensity of those moments, thus we become more attached to the ones we love. Living a longer life comes at the cost of seeing our close friends and relatives die. Usually, sudden death sorrows the relatives and close friends. Our beloved people live as long as we remember them. They are forever with us, banishing the sorrow that was brought together with their physical absence. Taking everything into consideration, I consider that it's better to live a shorter life that is more intense. That's how I want to spend the years of my life!

Because of the negative effects on health of an inactive lifestyle, all university students and school children should be forced to do sports activities at least 3 times per week. Do you agree? Write your **argumentative essay**.

Nowadays, sedentarism affects most students who decide to adopt an inactive lifestyle. It has a negative impact on our health, thus increasing the chances of contracting mortal diseases. Technology provides different ways of communication. Writing messages is a common technique that everybody uses in our epoch. Our eyesight suffers from this consequence, damaging faster than it has been in the past. But is it that difficult to connect with nature? I consider every student should be forced to do as many sports activities as possible. To begin with, an active lifestyle immunizes our bodies, protecting ourselves from different species of viruses. The contact with nature exposes us to multiple variants of bacteria that trigger our immune system to fight against them, albeit not being harmful to humans. Not only does an active lifestyle protect us from getting ill, but it also increases the quality of our sleep. Scientists proved that people who spend their time doing outdoor activities wake up feeling revitalized, no matter how turbulent their sleep was. Secondly, our health is affected spiritually. We forget how to socialize with each other. Connections between humans are established in an online environment, relying on an app to transmit a specific message. Taking part in a team sport helps in increasing awareness of others' feelings, thus developing communication skills. If I would have known that I can understand better my friends after taking part in these activities, I would have joined my local football team years ago. Not only do they increase awareness of how others are feeling, but sports also bring serenity and composure into our lives, concepts that are essential for our mental health. Concluding, doing sports activities in a school is beneficial for the students. I don't consider that, with 3 times per week, this represents an exhausting activity that overwhelms the children.

People rely on their digital assistant for the completion of their chores. Some of them keep in touch with their old parents and monitor their activity via their mobile phones. Others have office work, children to take care of and their entire social life in their mobile phones. Thus, a complete ban on mobile phones in public places will not be beneficial and will lead to public outrage.  To avoid such an outcome, we propose an alternative of limiting the usage. We can limit the time spent on the mobile phones to thirty minutes in a public place. Thirty minutes is enough for checking upon their children, elderly parents and for sorting their office work. The remaining time can be spent on interacting with others instead of hiding behind their screens. This solution will not only build upon the intention behind the original bill, but also take care of the health and growth of the public.  With people priortizing their tasks on their mobiles, we can expect to see a more lively crowd in the restaurants. I request you to go through our proposal and then make your decision. Thanking you, Yours sincerely,  David Hutton, Head of the Council of Men.

Is learning to speak a foreign language as important these days as it was in the past? Write an **essay** giving your opinion.

In my opinion, learning to speak a foreign language is very important.  On one hand, learning a foreign language is necessary for work and better prospects. And learning a new language may help you to solve many problems while travelling.  But on the other hand, I think language and culture is goes hand in hand together. For example, it is impossible to learn about countries culture without understanding their languages, because we can hardly understand their history, humours and custom.  So, what I think is the cultural subtleties and pop culture references might be lost without some grasp of the local language.  And, no matter in the past or present, learning a new language make you even smarter and probably lead your life to a new level.   These are the reasons that is why I think learning to speak a foreign language is still important in nowadays.

You have seen this notice in an international music magazine: **Articles wanted** **Do we need music in our lives?** Are there times when music is important? How does music make us feel? What would life be like without music? Write and tell us what you think. Write your **article** in **140 <U+2013> 190** words in an appropriate style.

Yes, we do. Music has been an important part of the human beings life since always. Actually many historicians and archaeologists have been able to demonstrate that primitive people, hundreds of thousands years ago, already used the music, and play some instruments like drums and flutes. Music can help us in many ways. Music can help us to calm and relax, to express sad emotions, or to have a fun time. Besides, music can help us to manage hard times and moments on our lives, like a break up or the death of someone dear. I myself usually listen to rock music when I'm angry, and calm and beautiful music when I'm sad or nostalgic. Furthermore, we can use the music to show our emotions and feelings for someone. Actually, many people use music to tell someone that they are in love with them. For all this reason, a life without music wouldn't be the same. Plus, for many people music are their job. What would they do without music then?

Read and answer the question below. Write at least 2 paragraphs. Some people sleep in a dark and quiet room. Other people sleep with a small light on and don't mind noise. How do you like to sleep? Explain your answer.

Well, I usually need to sleep in a dark and quiet room, withtout lights and noise. Besides, I need clean sheets and a warm blanket. I've slept in this way since I was a child, and I don't have any intention to change it. However, some times I've could manage to sleep in worse conditions, for example, when I've been very tired or drunk. Anyway, I need dark and silence to sleep because I usually have a lot of problems to fall sleep for my own. I only sleep at night, and only for a few hours. I always try to sleep the eight hours that the doctors recommended, but I rarely can do it.

Write to a student in another country describing a special food you like to eat. Make sure to tell them: <U+25CF> what the food is <U+25CF> when you usually eat the food <U+25CF> why you like this food Include more details. Write at least one paragraph.

Dear Jon: I'm glad you emailed me. Well, there are a lot of wonderful foods in my country, Spain, and I like many of them. That's why it's pretty difficult to me choose only one of them. Among my favorite foods are meatballs, croquettes or spaghetti carbonara. However, my favorite food is stewed lentils undoubtedly. I've loved this dish since I was a child, and I've eaten it at least once a week since then. I usually eat stewed lentils for lunch, although I've eaten it for dinner too sometimes. I like stewed lentils because it's a very tasty food, and very nutritive too.

* What is your favorite indoor activity? * Why do you like this activity? * Tell us about the last time that you did this activity.

Well,  I have more than one favorite indoor activities. What one I choose to do is mostly up to what I feel like doing that day or moment. I really enjoy cooking. I'm capable of cooking since I was a kid, and I'm used to cooking for me and my parents every day. This is an activity that relax me a lot. I've always been capable of forgetting all my daily problems while I'm cooking something tasty. The last time I cook was yesterday, and I'll start to cook when I'll finish write this. Besides, I like to play video games. I've played video games since I was a kid too, and I really enjoy doing it. I rather role and strategic games than sports games, and I think I've played almost every game that I've wanted. However, I look forward to buying the newest Final Fantasy game soon, but it's very expensive now. I don't want to spend too much in a simple video game. Last but not least, I like to do exercise at home, like bicycle or push-ups. I feel really healthy doing that, and this activity help me to get rid of the daily stress.
